sentences.sContent: I think your upbringing has prejudiced you.
sentences.sCn: 我认为你的教养使你抱有偏见。

sentences.sContent: The report was held back for fear of prejudicing his trial.
sentences.sCn: 因为担心会使他的审判带有偏见，该报告没有公开。

remMethod.val: pre (预先) + jud (判断) + ice (表行为) → 先入为主的判断， 容易产生偏见 → 偏见， 成见

words.tran: 怀偏见的；有成见的；偏颇的
不利的；有害的；引起偏见的
损害（prejudice的过去分词）；使抱偏见

trans.tranCn: 使抱偏见； 影响某人； 损害
trans.tranOther: If you prejudice someone or something, you influence them so that they are unfair in some way
an un-reasonable dislike and distrust of people who are different from you in some way, especially because of their race, sex, religion etc – used to show disapproval
